title: Mobile-first birthday website for Gray with landing page, animated GIF carousel, and dynamic mood chat pages

requirements.text: Create a frontend-only single-page app experience with client-side routing for: (1) a landing page at "/" and (2) dynamic mood pages at "/mood/:slug" (e.g., "/mood/sad").

quotes: Clicking one routes to a dynamic mood page (e.g., /mood/[slug]).

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating from the landing page to any mood card updates the URL to /mood/<slug> and renders the mood page without a full page reload.
Refreshing the browser on /mood/<slug> still loads the correct mood page.
At least the following slugs are supported: sad, doubt, laugh, celebrate, stressed (names can match data IDs).

requirements.text: Add a static TypeScript mock data module (e.g., frontend/src/data.ts) that exports MoodSection and Message types and a list of MoodSection records, structured so URLs/text can be swapped later without code changes.

quotes: Create a data.ts file. Structure it so I can easily swap in the real links later.

acceptanceCriteria: data.ts defines the Message and MoodSection types exactly as described (id, type, content, senderName, senderGifUrl; and mood id, title, themeColor, backgroundGradient, messages).
Landing page and mood pages read from this data module (no backend calls).
Data includes 5 mood sections that correspond to the landing page navigation labels.

requirements.text: Implement the landing page ("/") with a light, airy, celebratory design (soft pastels/whites/subtle gradients), strict mobile-first layout, and clean typography.

quotes: Theme: Light, airy, and celebratory. Soft pastels, whites, and subtle gradients.
Responsiveness: Strict Mobile-First approach.

acceptanceCriteria: On small screens (e.g., ~375px width), spacing and typography are comfortable and not cramped; content does not overflow horizontally.
Tailwind responsive typography uses smaller defaults on mobile and scales up at md+ (e.g., text-sm base, text-base at md, and larger headings at lg).
Overall styling matches an “high-end digital greeting card” + “modern chat app” feel.

requirements.text: Add a landing-page hero section that displays a 3-GIF carousel for Gray with an infinite auto-play cross-fade transition (no hard cuts).

quotes: Display a container with 3 user-provided GIFs of Gray.
Implement a smooth cross-fade loop (infinite auto-play) using Framer Motion AnimatePresence. No jarring cuts.

acceptanceCriteria: Carousel cycles through exactly 3 GIF URLs sourced from the static data module (or a dedicated constant in the same module).
Transitions are cross-fade (opacity) and loop infinitely on a timer.
Only one GIF is visible at a time and the change is smooth (no flash/jump).
Hero remains responsive: maintains aspect ratio and looks good from mobile to desktop.

requirements.text: Add a poem section under the hero that uses a cursive/handwritten font for headings/poem text, centered and readable, with scroll-triggered reveal animation line-by-line or word-by-word.

quotes: Below the hero, display a heartfelt poem.
Use the Cursive font. Make it centered, elegant, and readable.
Fade in the text line-by-line or word-by-word as the user scrolls.

acceptanceCriteria: Poem text is centered and uses a distinct cursive/handwritten font compared to body text.
The reveal animation triggers as the poem scrolls into view and reveals progressively (line or word).
Animation is smooth on mobile and does not cause layout shifts (no jank).

requirements.text: Implement an “Open when” navigation grid on the landing page with 5 distinctive cards/buttons labeled exactly: (1) Open when you feel sad (2) Open when doubting yourself (3) Open when you want to laugh (4) Open when celebrating something big (5) Open when overwhelmed or stressed; each navigates to its corresponding /mood/:slug page and has satisfying hover/tap scale feedback.

quotes: Create 5 distinctive buttons/cards with the following labels:
Open when you feel sad
Open when doubting yourself
Open when you want to laugh
Open when celebrating something big
Open when overwhelmed or stressed
Interaction: These buttons should have a satisfying hover/tap scale effect. Clicking one routes to a dynamic mood page (e.g., /mood/[slug]).

acceptanceCriteria: All 5 labels match the provided text exactly.
Cards are laid out mobile-first (single column or 2-column as space allows) and become a grid on larger screens.
Hover (desktop) and tap (mobile) scale interactions are implemented and feel responsive.
Clicking a card navigates to the correct mood slug derived from the static data module.

requirements.text: Add landing-page footer actions with two distinct buttons: “Personal Playlist” and “Love Globe”, implemented as visual placeholders that only log a message to the console when clicked.

quotes: Two distinct buttons at the bottom: "Personal Playlist" and "Love Globe".
Note: These are currently visual placeholders; simply log to the console when clicked.

acceptanceCriteria: Both buttons render at the bottom of the landing page and are visually distinct.
Clicking each button triggers a unique console.log message identifying which button was clicked.
No navigation or backend calls occur from these buttons.

requirements.text: Implement dynamic mood pages at "/mood/:slug" that load the selected MoodSection from the static data module and apply mood-based theming (background gradient, accent colors, overall vibe) per mood.

quotes: Dynamic Theming: The background color, accent colors, and overall "vibe" must change based on the selected mood

acceptanceCriteria: For each mood slug, page background and accents change according to the MoodSection fields (themeColor and backgroundGradient).
At least these mood vibes are clearly differentiated: sad (soft blues/lavenders), celebrate (vibrant gold/confetti-like), stressed (calming sage/green).
If an unknown slug is visited, a user-friendly not-found state is shown with a way back to the landing page.

requirements.text: Create a premium chat-thread UI on mood pages that mimics a high-end WhatsApp/iMessage thread: message bubbles render text/audio/video message types, sender avatars are small looping GIFs, and message alignment alternates (or uses a consistent timeline style).

quotes: Layout: mimic a premium WhatsApp/iMessage thread.
Avatar: Instead of static profile pics, use small looping GIFs for the sender.
Bubbles: Render messages (Text, Audio players, or Video embeds) in chat bubbles.
Alignment: Alternating sides or centered "timeline" style

acceptanceCriteria: Each message shows senderName and a GIF avatar (senderGifUrl) in/near the bubble.
Text messages render readable wrapped text with proper padding.
Audio messages render with an HTML5 audio player inside a bubble.
Video messages render as an embedded player (iframe or video) sized responsively within a bubble.
Message alignment is consistent and clearly intentional (alternating sides or a centered timeline).

requirements.text: Add motion/animation polish: (1) mood-page message list staggers in on initial load with fade + slide-up from bottom, and (2) add page transitions between routes that feel smooth and celebratory.

quotes: Animation: Messages should stagger-animate in from the bottom (fade + slide up) when the page loads.
Focus heavily on the Framer Motion components for the GIF carousel and Page Transitions.

acceptanceCriteria: On entering a mood page, messages animate in with a stagger (not all at once) using fade + upward movement.
Route transitions between landing and mood pages animate smoothly (no abrupt content swap).
Animations remain performant on mobile (no noticeable frame drops during basic navigation).

requirements.text: Add global typography setup with two Google fonts: a clean sans-serif for body text and a premium cursive/handwritten font for poem text and key headings; ensure consistent application across the app.

quotes: Use a clean Sans-Serif for body text and a premium Cursive/Handwritten font like Great Vibes or Dancing Script for poems and headings.

acceptanceCriteria: Body text uses the sans-serif font across pages.
Poem section and designated headings use the cursive/handwritten font.
Font loading does not cause major layout shift (use sensible fallbacks and consistent sizing).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui; compose them from outside if needed (read-only UI sources).

Do not edit frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths); integrate routing/pages/components without changing these files.
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko; do not introduce additional backend services or external databases.
Do not implement third-party authentication providers; Internet Identity is the only supported auth mechanism (not required for this app).
nonGoals: No backend persistence, admin panel, or database integration.
No real playlist integration or globe feature implementation beyond console logging placeholders.
No third-party API integrations (social media, maps, websockets, push notifications, email/SMS).
